item.title: ECMWF—欧洲中期天气预报中心
item.description:
1. Introduction

欧洲中期天气预报中心（European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts 简称 ECMWF）是一个包括34个国家支持的国际性组织，是当今全球独树一帜的国际性天气预报研究和业务机构。其前身为欧洲的一个科学与技术合作项目。1975年ECMWF正式成立，总部设在英国的Bracknell。——欧洲中期天气预报中心-百度百科

主页：ECMWF | Advancing global NWP through international collaboration

数据： https://www.ecmwf.int/en/forecasts/datasets

开放数据：

  • https://www.ecmwf.int/en/about/media-centre/news/2020/ecmwf-moves-towards-policy-open-data
  • ECMWF | Charts

2. References

  • 欧洲中期天气预报中心-百度百科

item.title: GlobeLand30
item.description:
1. Introduction

GlobeLand30是中国研制的30米空间分辨率全球地表覆盖数据。

主页： http://www.globallandcover.com/home.html?type=data

下载： http://www.globallandcover.com/defaults.html?src=https://xiaoledeng.github.io/Scripts/map/defaults/download.html&head=download&type=data

2. Reference

Jun, C., Ban, Y., & Li, S. (2014). Open access to Earth land-cover map. Nature, 514(7523), 434-434. https://doi.org/10.1038/514434c

Chen, J., & Chen, J. (2018). GlobeLand30: Operational global land cover mapping and big-data analysis. Science China Earth Sciences, 61(10), 1533-1534. , https://doi.org/10.1007/s11430-018-9255-3

item.title: GLC_FCS30-2020: Global Land Cover with Fine Classification System at 30m in 2020
item.description:
1. Introduction

反映了2020年全球陆地区域（除南极洲）在30米空间分辨率下的地表覆盖分布状况。

Download: https://zenodo.org/record/4280923#.X8XQ0cszb0o

2. Reference

  • https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UquWIWnd9kZfISbyYJxr_Q

item.title: CLAS: Chinese Lithospheric model derived from Aeromagnetic data and Satellite models
item.description:
1. Introduction

Abstract from Jiang et al. (2020):

We present new regional models, denoted CLAS (Chinese Lithospheric model derived from Aeromagnetic data and Satellite models), of the Chinese lithospheric field, combining the long wavelength information provided by satellite-derived models: CHAOS-6, MF7, LCS-1 and NGDC720, and an extremely high-quality compilation of 97994 aeromagnetic survey data with 10km × 10km resolution for shorter wavelength.

2. Reference

Jiang, Y., Holme, R., Xiong, S. Q., Jiang, Y., Feng, Y., & Yang, H. (2020). Long-wavelength lithospheric magnetic field of China. Geophysical Journal International. https://doi.org/10.1093/gji/ggaa490

item.title: MERIT DEM: Multi‐Error‐Removed Improved‐Terrain DEM
item.description:
1. Introduction

The MERIT DEM was developed by removing multiple error components (absolute bias, stripe noise, speckle noise, and tree height bias) from the existing spaceborne DEMs (SRTM3 v2.1 and AW3D-30m v1). It represents the terrain elevations at a 3sec resolution (-90m at the equator), and covers land areas between 90N-60S, referenced to EGM96 geoid.

Download: http://hydro.iis.u-tokyo.ac.jp/~yamadai/MERIT_DEM/

2. Reference

Yamazaki, D., Ikeshima, D., Tawatari, R., Yamaguchi, T., O’Loughlin, F., Neal, J. C., … & Bates, P. D. (2017). A high‐accuracy map of global terrain elevations. Geophysical Research Letters, 44(11), 5844-5853. https://doi.org/10.1002/2017GL072874

item.title: SRTM2gravity: Global Gravimetric Terrain Corrections Models
item.description:
1. Introduction
